titleproper.value:
Guide to the Irma Tuck Weiss Papers
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1954-1986</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MC 211</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Clotilde Trouve and University Archives staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2009-05-07T13:56-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Irma Tuck Weiss was a professor of biochemistry at New York University from 1950-1978. From 1980-1981, she also served as the president of the College of Dentistry at New York University. Her main research topics included human saliva. This collection is comprised of her notes and research analyses.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); The Irma Tuck-Weiss Papers; MC 211; box number; folder number; 
                <address>
                    <addressline>New York University</addressline>
                </address>
She died on February 19, 2004 in New York. A scholarship was established in her honor.

This collection contains notes, paper electropherograms and writings by Dr. Irma Tuck-Weiss. The bulk of the collection documents Dr. Tuck-Weiss' professional life through correspondence, published articles, historical research, and information regarding her membership in various professional associations.

corpname.value: New York University. College of Dentistry.
